author: JumpingYang001
body:
## Steps to reproduce

I try test global:func as below, it shows it not work as expect:

```
PS /workspace/PowerShell> function global:func { 'global' };
PS /workspace/PowerShell> function func { 'default' };
PS /workspace/PowerShell> global:func;
default
```
## Expected behavior

"global:func;"'s output should be global
## Actual behavior

"global:func;"'s output is default
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell

PS /root> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.10032.0
PSEdition                      Linux
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v0.5.0-73-g1476be8ecf907c105210ed3b22289872c0578593
CLRVersion
WSManStackVersion              1.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
PS /root>

```

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: @JumpingYang001 Can you please use the Issue template to give more details about your environment?

comments.author: JumpingYang001
comments.body: @joeyaiello I have update as template, thanks.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: This is by design. `function func { 'default' };` when called from interactive session does implicit overwrite for the global one.

title: global:func not work?
